newsitem.title: USA: Gap "well positioned" for school season, Q3.
newsitem.headline: Gap "well positioned" for school season, Q3.

text.p: Gap Inc, the casual clothing chain, said Thursday it is "well positioned" for the back-to-school season and the third quarter.
Millard Drexler, president and chief executive officer, said the chain's current merchandise assortments "reflect our renewed focus on dominant presentation of Gap franchise categories.
"We also continue to build our brands, stepping up our investment in advertising and marketing, including national television ads for Gap, GapKids and Old Navy," he said.
He made the statement as Gap reported that its net sales grew 20 percent to $1.345 billion in the second quarter ended August 2 from $1.12 billion in the same quarter in 1996.
Comparable store sales grew four percent while net earnings rose six percent to $69.5 million, compared with $65.8 million in the quarter a year-ago.
Earnings per share, reflecting an ongoing share repurchase program, grew 13 percent to $0.26 from $0.23 a year ago.
